title: Analysts: It's Going To Be An Amazing Year For 11 Companies
summary:
XAnalysts pinpoint just 11 S&P 500 companies, like materials firm Newmont (NEM) plus communications services companies Netflix (NFLX) and Activision (ATVI), to put up strong results all around.
These companies' key dimensions — earnings, revenue and stock price — will each jump 10% or more this year, analysts say.
All 11 S&P 500 companies also sport lofty IBD Composite Ratings.
Thriving In 2020 Isn't Easy For S&P 500 CompaniesFinding S&P 500 companies with across-the-board double-digit growth isn't easy.
Some S&P 500 All-Around Winners Have Upside LeftNot all S&P 500 all-around winners hit their targets just yet.
text:
It's been an ugly year so far for most companies. But believe it or not, some S&P 500 members are flourishing in all ways in 2020.

X

Analysts pinpoint just 11 S&P 500 companies, like materials firm Newmont (NEM) plus communications services companies Netflix (NFLX) and Activision (ATVI), to put up strong results all around. At least in the areas investors watch: Revenue growth, earnings growth and stock price.

That's according to an Investor's Business Daily analysis of data from S&P Global Market Intelligence and Marketsmith.

These companies' key dimensions — earnings, revenue and stock price — will each jump 10% or more this year, analysts say. All 11 S&P 500 companies also sport lofty IBD Composite Ratings.

And above all, these companies could lead the way beyond the first quarter to what really matters: Recovery.

"This recession is unique, but that might not be all bad news," said LPL Financial Senior Market Strategist Ryan Detrick. "We've had to flip a switch on the economy, essentially front-loading an entire recession's worth of damage into a couple months, creating some all-time dismal data. But that means we'll eventually be able to flip it back on, supporting a robust recovery."

Thriving In 2020 Isn't Easy For S&P 500 Companies

Finding S&P 500 companies with across-the-board double-digit growth isn't easy. Growth in just one of these dimensions is hard to find this year. In all three? Nearly impossible.

Consider the statistics. S&P 500 revenue is expected to drop 2.9% this year, says FactSet. Only 45 S&P 500 companies are on pace to boost revenue by 10% or more.

And the S&P 500's profit picture is even worse. Earnings are expected to drop nearly 18% in 2020. And analysts think just 49 companies in the S&P 500 will boost earnings by 10% or more in 2020.

And when the year's over, less than 70 S&P 500 stocks will be higher at all than they were on January 1, analysts say. Consider that the S&P 500 is still down roughly 10% on the year.

So to grow 10% in all three measures is a feat.

Netflix And The Other Top S&P 500

Video streamer Netflix in many ways show how 2020 isn't a disaster for all companies. It's one of six of the all-around winners with a perfect 99 IBD Composite Rating.

And if you look closely, you can see why. The company's revenue is seen jumping nearly 23% this year to $24.7 billion. Meanwhile, adjusted earnings per share at Netflix is on pace to hit $6.41 a share. That's a 55% jump.

What about Netflix' stock? Analysts think it will be worth more than $440 in 12 months. If they're right, that's a 36% gain from where the stock started the year. Keep in mind, though, the stock is already up 34.5% this year. You'll want to make sure you buy it at the right time.

Some S&P 500 All-Around Winners Have Upside Left

Not all S&P 500 all-around winners hit their targets just yet. Look at gold miner Newmont. Analysts think the company's revenue and profit will rise 13.7% and 54%, respectively this year. And the stock is up 48.6% this year to 64.55, explaining the 98 Composite Rating.

But still, the 12-month price target on the stock is higher still, 66.90. And if earnings keep coming in better than expected, there could be more price-target hikes coming.

That's been the case at video-game company Activision. The company is perfectly positioned for more people looking for in-house entertainment.

Analysts think Activision's revenue will jump nearly 12% this year. And earnings are seen gaining 22% in 2020. All told, analysts think the stock will be worth 75.71 in 12 months — a 27% implied gain this year. Shares this year are already up 23% to 73.14. Here's what to consider when looking to buy this stock.

Keep in mind, when companies are doing this well, estimates can still move higher. Activision, for instance, beat first-quarter earnings estimates by a whopping 53% on May 5. And not surprisingly, analysts boosted their profit forecast for the year by 10% in just a month.

Just because the nation is locked down doesn't mean you're locked out of ways to profit. S&P 500 investors can make money, if they know where to look.

S&P 500 Companies See Growing Price, Revenue And Earnings This Year

Company Ticker 2020 Expected Stock Gain %* Revenue Growth Expected In 2020 2020 EPS Growth Forecast Sector Composite Rating Netflix (NFLX) 36.0% 22.7% 55.3% Communication Services 99 ServiceNow (NOW) 30.6% 25.7% 27.5% Information Technology 99 Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX) 28.7% 36.9% 62.6% Health Care 99 NVIDIA (NVDA) 26.7% 20.4% 29.5% Information Technology 99 Fortinet (FTNT) 17.0% 15.7% 13.7% Information Technology 99 Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) 12.9% 24.7% 61.0% Information Technology 99 Newmont (NEM) 54.0% 13.7% 54.2% Materials 98 MarketAxess (MKTX) 14.5% 25.7% 26.7% Financials 98 Synopsys (SNPS) 20.5% 11.2% 24.2% Information Technology 93 Danaher (DHR) 11.9% 14.2% 12.3% Health Care 92 Activision Blizzard (ATVI) 27.4% 11.6% 21.7% Communication Services 91

Source: IBD, S&P Global Market Intelligence, * - based on 12-month price target from beginning of the year

Follow Matt Krantz on Twitter @mattkrantz

      Licensing
      • MATT KRANTZ
      • 08:00 AM ET 05/11/2020

      It's been an ugly year so far for most companies. But believe it or not, some S&P 500 members are flourishing in all ways in 2020.

      Company Ticker 2020 Expected Stock Gain %* Revenue Growth Expected In 2020 2020 EPS Growth Forecast Sector Composite Rating
      Netflix (NFLX) 36.0% 22.7% 55.3% Communication Services 99
      ServiceNow (NOW) 30.6% 25.7% 27.5% Information Technology 99
      Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX) 28.7% 36.9% 62.6% Health Care 99
